website_summaries.verdict: Stands our for both beauty and practicality. If you're looking for a fire pit that adds a bright spot to your outdoor living space, this model could be for you.
pros: Natural copper build is attractive, lightweight, and durable
owners report no corrosion after years of use
Deep build is ideal for burning logs
cons: On the higher end of the price spectrum
The stand is flimsy, and the legs are prone to sinking into the ground on some surfaces

customer_reviews.title: Excellent beautiful product.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. No assembly required. Packaged well with no damage. Looks beautiful. Yes it's going to discolor. It's copper. I read some of the reviews and they were disappointed it tarnished...? Really? Trying throwing an old penny in the fire and see what happens. It can be cleaned.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: Update 5 years in...
customer_reviews.text: Would never go to steel again after having this for over 3 years. Not a hint of corrosion. It does turn black with the heat, though, but this thing works great otherwise. 5-year update:. The bowl is fantastic still. I built a stone pit last year and used the copper bowl as an insert. It worked perfectly. The screen cover is in great shape long after the vinyl one ripped out. I can't imagine any other bowl holding up this well. Super pleased with this buy.
customer_reviews.author: C. Zecca

customer_reviews.title: Very stylish and well-done fire pit
customer_reviews.text: This fire pit looks like it is well put together. The pit is solid copper and the spark cover is heavy-duty. Like other reviews the cover is very cheep so I bought another cover from Amazon for $7. I did drill a hole in the bottom for water drainage if needed and filled the bottom with fine rock (a little bigger than sand) to help protect the bottom from the Heat and add a little weight. I also drilled holes behind the legs for air intake for better fire combustion. (Less Smoky fire) . I didn't want a normal Rock fire pit so this will work beautifully. I expect it to last for many years
customer_reviews.author: Russ S.

customer_reviews.title: Cover requires two people to put in place
customer_reviews.text: I like this fire pit so far. I cannot speak to the long-term durability yet. The biggest FAIL of this thing is the cover. It is SO TIGHT that it takes two people to stretch the thing so it is covered. you seriously need three arms holding the elastic in place at 3 equidistant points around this thing with a fourth arm stretching the final point. If there was one thing I would recommend it would be for the manufacturer to NOT CHEAP OUT on easily the most inexpensive item in this package. Just make the thing a little larger so that one person can easily stretch the cover and put it on.
customer_reviews.author: chrisjweaver

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Copper Alloy
customer_reviews.text: It passed the “magnet test,” but during the first burn, began changing colours to a dull grey on the outside. I always use hardwood in my fire pits and specifically chose copper for its supposed durability. We’ll see. I’m not very happy considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: Red Celt

customer_reviews.title: Good pit but needs a more durable top.
customer_reviews.text: Today is 10/4/2020. Purchased and used pretty regularly in Upstate NY since 3/23/2019. Have stored outside for 1 winter kind of covered from the snow. Stand is holding up and slight surface rust is starting to show. Copper tub/pit is no longer shiny but has become more matte black - which i’m fine with. Because it is copper, I’m easily able to hammer dents out with a light tight of a hammer or even a piece of wood. **Top steel metal mesh is highly disappointing :/ and there is a lot of rust and the mesh has separated from rivets, mesh also gets easily deformed.
customer_reviews.author: 3BoyMom

customer_reviews.title: Great fire pit
customer_reviews.text: Great fire pit, looks really beautiful and functions well. Please nobody pay for "expert assembly" unless you have no arms and legs. You would have to be a complete stranger to basic shapes (like circles) to not be able to assemble this. This literally took 2 minutes to assemble (which is a great thing minus the fact there is a $100 option for "expert assembly"). Maybe I'm an expert and had no idea...I should be getting PAID! In all seriousness this is a great fire pit and is easier to assemble than it is to remember to breathe. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Richard J.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great! Very thin copper
customer_reviews.text: Looks great! Very thin copper. we'll see how long it lasts.. Well...the cover has completely disintegrated (came apart as I tried to put it back on this a.m.) after 1 summer. The cover was removed and put back on about 8 times total. Everything else still holding together.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: What a great addition to our pergola
customer_reviews.text: The hand hammered copper fire pit is just stunning! We received it promptly (ordered on a Thursday evening and it arrived by Saturday!) We had read other reviews about the lack of ventilation holes and drainage holes. So instead of drilling into the beautiful copper bowl as others had done, we simply went to our local hardware store and bought a small fireplace log holder. We had our first fire and it was beautiful! The grate allows for ventilation to feed the logs and kindling for a great fire that is so magical as the glowing copper seemed to comes alive! We bought a sturdier cover to fend off the Florida elements.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Stachler

customer_reviews.title: Not 100% Copper?
customer_reviews.text: It literally took us 4 tries to receive this pit. Each time our order was “Prime” and after about 5 days we would receive a notification that our package was lost and it would take another week to receive the refund. Once was finally received it, it was pretty until we used it. Now it’s an eyesore. Entire inside and outside of bowl turned to an ugly ashy gray. The smoke screen was disfigured after 1 use. I’m not convinced the bowl is solid copper, otherwise it should not have turned gray after 1 use.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony J Damato

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we wanted.
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid of buying a fire pit that was too small sight unseen. Well this one is large & the perfect depth. I love the hammered copper, set up was a breeze. It literally took me 5 minutes. We would def purchase this again!
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful fire pit... defective screen handle
customer_reviews.text: This fire pit looks beautiful and is the perfect size for the space we had. Unfortunately, the handle on the protective screen lid already came off after only using it 5 times. So the lid is way more difficult to put on and almost impossible to remove when the fire is going unless we kick it off to the side or use oven mitts to grab it from both sides to lift it off.
customer_reviews.author: Dena Towning

customer_reviews.title: Lid wasn't completely square with the vessel
customer_reviews.text: Easy, attractive, and pretty solid. No assembly needed, you just unpack and drop the copper vessel into the base. The vessel is nice and deep. There are no holes in the bottom, so you need to be sure to cover it up or put it away before a rain comes. It was a bit of work to coax the screen/lid into a proper fit atop the vessel. Either the lid or the vessel was probably bent slightly out of shape during shipping. The included vinyl cover has a spandex ring and fits snugly, though I don't see it lasting more than a couple of years.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L

customer_reviews.title: Really easy set-up and besutiful looks.
customer_reviews.text: I just got this so I will submit another review after we use it a while. It is so easy to set up, comes with a super nice cover, and looks beautiful on my patio. I have three chairs around it with room for more. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Meme

customer_reviews.title: Looks great!
customer_reviews.text: Screen cover had a few "dents" from shipping but easy enough to pop out. I had an extra can of black spray paint so I sprayed the screen and the stand with another coat. I had read some negative reviews about rust problems. This should help.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Maramara

customer_reviews.title: Looks great & can't wait to use it!
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to use my fire pit but it arrived on time in great condition. It looks great ... appears to be well made ... light weight ..easy to assemble (really no assembly required...just place the 'pit' in the ring holder & then the screen on top..simple). The only reason I could not give the fire pit 5 Stars is because I have not had an opportunity to actually use it.
customer_reviews.author: KidneyCove3

customer_reviews.title: Beware of teeny cover!
customer_reviews.text: Looks great. Filled it with sand as advised. But, once it was set up I went to put the cover on and...what???? It’s only about half as big as it need to be to fit over the fire bowl. Other pictures here show the cover as fitting, so what happened with mine? I finally had to cut the elastic to get it to fit over the bowl. Are others here having the same issue?
customer_reviews.author: Grippy

customer_reviews.title: Love this fire pit
customer_reviews.text: Love this fire pit. Legs may rust over time, which I will replace, but copper base will last for ever. Do not use the screen cover. Started using the fire pit the fall of 2017.
customer_reviews.author: JACK J LYON II

customer_reviews.title: Great Firepit- lousy raincover.
customer_reviews.text: exceeded my high expectation sin appearance, workmanship, and ease of assembly (took about 5 seconds !) looks great in my yard, quite a talking point already ! Very stable stand on brick patio.Nice high spark hood. only downside ? the cover !! there is NO WAY you can get that cover on . If you start to pull it starts to come apart.the elastic to hold it is way too tightly done and the aperture way too small,unless they sent the wrong cover.
customer_reviews.author: birdaoir

customer_reviews.title: Copper kettle damaged
customer_reviews.text: When I received the package there was slight Damage to the outer cardboard box. I didn't think much of it because it was not severe, but when I removed The Copper kettle It had a dent in it. It is not bad enough To go through the hassle of packaging it up again, and returning it, But I think some kind of credit should be issued. Please advise. I have pictures if you would like to see them.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Copper turns blackish grey after one use.
customer_reviews.text: This came out of the box beautiful. One fire later and the “copper” is gone. The meta tub turned blackish grey after one fire.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still works fine though.
customer_reviews.text: Positive: Copper is definitely heavier gauge than expected. Negative: the iron metal cover (for sparks) doesn't perfectly fit. Could be an issue with slight bending during shipping, but I haven't been able to get it to fit right. Still works fine though.
customer_reviews.author: MojoMac

customer_reviews.title: Customer service was outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: The fire pit cover looks and works great but the customer service for a service need was outstanding. I will be buying here again.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Smothers

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Am paranoid about heat under base on Trex deck, which it does not seem to have marked, but I will cut a disk of Hardy board anyway. Has adopted a nice variegated color.
customer_reviews.author: TWG

customer_reviews.title: Copper Glow
customer_reviews.text: Hand made....and worth the wait to receive. This piece is of very high quality materials...and what a beautiful platform for my fires!
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Hutmacher

customer_reviews.title: Nice fire pit
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking. Works well. Needs a grate inside to put the wood on and holes drilled underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Copper for 1 fire.
customer_reviews.text: After 1 fire the copper color is completely gone. Wish I would have known.
customer_reviews.author: stereoguy

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful fire pit with some quirks
customer_reviews.text: Really beautiful fire pit. Fits large sized logs well. Perfect for a small patio. The cover is too tight to easily put on. I had to make a slit it in to get it to fit. Rainwater collecting in it is a problem. But all in all, I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Guiduchi

customer_reviews.title: Unique with minor flaws
customer_reviews.text: Super awesome fire pit but the stand is flimsy and if you live in a rainy region drill some holes to avoid having a fire pit / swimming pool
customer_reviews.author: corey potter

customer_reviews.title: Cover doesn't fit and came with tears
customer_reviews.text: The firepit is very pretty, easy to assemble, and seems sturdy. The cover will not go over it at all, it's super flimsy, and it had tears in it. We tossed it directly into the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Zachman

customer_reviews.title: Really do love this. It's very similar to the one we ...
customer_reviews.text: Really do love this. It's very similar to the one we bought years ago from Walmart. We bought it in 2008 and are still using it though it has a few small holes in it. We bought this one to use when the other wears out. Can't go wrong with these!
customer_reviews.author: C. Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Be very careful
customer_reviews.text: Don't fool yourself - this is a very large kettle that generates a LOT of heat. The copper is a very efficient conductor so anything too close WILL catch on fire. Also, I had to drill a hole in the bottom to drain rainwater. Seems an oversight.
customer_reviews.author: D. durkes

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and well made.
customer_reviews.text: As usual, Amazon delivered the product quickly. We've used the fire pit a few times. It is a very beautiful fire pit. Though the copper bowl is on the thin side, I'm rather glad because it makes it easier to move around, especially with sand in it. We've received quite a bit of compliments on it. I hope it holds and lasts for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Fanny Burney

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It's so beautiful. I get a lot of compliments. I have enjoyed the color change and it's easy to move. The cover fits good toovand covers the whole thing.
customer_reviews.author: MSMeka

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great pit, Beautiful, but it did come in with a dent in the bottom of the bowl
customer_reviews.author: TANYA

customer_reviews.title: Dented
customer_reviews.text: Product is nice, easy to assemble but arrived with big denton the side. Already threw away box so can't return it. Mesh top has a few dents too!
customer_reviews.author: Lynette Brown

customer_reviews.title: I really like it!
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoying this fire pit! Came out together. Sturdy. Nice addition to the patio!
customer_reviews.author: Lis

customer_reviews.title: Nice deep pit
customer_reviews.text: Nice deep pit, the copper warms up for addition heat. Looks great, just add some sand to protect the bottom. The spark arrestor is heavy and cover fits nicely to keep the rain out.
customer_reviews.author: lap

customer_reviews.title: I really liked that it came with a screen and a cover ...
customer_reviews.text: This is truly a big fire pit. Very light for the size. I really liked that it came with a screen and a cover too. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous fire pit. Very deep and holds well up ...
customer_reviews.text: Gorgeous fire pit. Very deep and holds well up to the elements here in Florida.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Knudsen

customer_reviews.title: Nice large pit
customer_reviews.text: Nice large pit. Copper darkens right away from the heat but if you want you can clean it with a copper cleaner. Light, so it is easily moved.
customer_reviews.author: James S. Shields

customer_reviews.title: Fire pit is unsafe
customer_reviews.text: The fire pit burnt out grass with the first use. The bottom of the fire pit is damaged after the first use. It does not appear to safe to use.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Came with a dent and no vinyl cover.
customer_reviews.text: Item delivered with vinyl cover missing and copper bowl was dented. Aside from that, looks as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: GD

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful! Haven't been able to actually use it as it has been raining in So California almost every weekend but it looks great on the patio.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: missing the cover
customer_reviews.text: Product is lovely but, it is missing the cover. Please send me a cover.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great anniversary gift for friends
customer_reviews.text: Good value. Well-made. I would order one of the better rain covers because the one that comes with it is inadequate.
customer_reviews.author: BookloverT

customer_reviews.title: Great fire pit
customer_reviews.text: I love my fire pit! Thanks to the folks that suggested putting sand in the bottom. It is sturdy and well made. Yes it discolors but it is a fire pit! Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Mackey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Item is of good quality and was shipped as said. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Marco Amador

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fire pit
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be happier with this fire pit. Love the look & functionality.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Like it a lot
customer_reviews.text: Like it a lot. The copper tub is not as thick as expected but seems very sturdy nonetheless. Looks awesome!!
customer_reviews.author: TheJohnHurlow

customer_reviews.title: Clean Lines, good value
customer_reviews.text: Very functional without the clutter of unnecessary structural elements. Lost 1 star because tack welds holding the iron ring and legs together do not appear very substantial, but that is a minor repair if needed.
customer_reviews.author: HEM47

customer_reviews.title: Like
customer_reviews.text: Only had this for a week so hard to say much.
customer_reviews.author: Dellies

customer_reviews.title: This was a birthday gift and he loved it. We are looking forward to using it ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday gift and he loved it. We are looking forward to using it as soon as it cools off!!
customer_reviews.author: carol

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice fire pits to have in my back yard.
customer_reviews.author: B. Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for the Home Depot bargain fire pit. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Good thing we started small and inexpensive. After two years the $40 copper clad, began to fail. This was a reach we thought. Well it was worth every penny. Heavy gage copper, cleans well. Takes lots of wood, or just a wee bit. Beautiful to watch combustion. The screen top is great keeps flying bits in, and acts as a wind break in gusts. When the box arrives you may think its a mistake in the size, but packaging is all important. WE ARE SO PLEASED
customer_reviews.author: maclaugh

customer_reviews.title: This is a great fire pit
customer_reviews.text: This is a great fire pit. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because the cover that comes with it is very flimsy and tore within weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Gpink17

customer_reviews.title: shipped as promised
customer_reviews.text: The item is well made and sturdy. Very clean and simple design. Light enough to carry and clean easily. highly recommend this fire pit.
customer_reviews.author: Astrid

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: The copper basin is exactly what I expected and hoped for. I would give 5 stars if it came with a taller base.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fire pit, just the right size for a patio evening fire
customer_reviews.author: Charles Blackwell

customer_reviews.title: OK for very small fires
customer_reviews.text: The fire pit itself is fine for small, very small fires. If you want a bonfire DO NOT USE THIS. The worst part of the product are the short and stubby feet. They sink right into any type of ground other than concrete or brick and, frankly, they are too short to make a fire on brick. Most of all do not expect the cover that comes with it to last more than 4 months. It ripped right in half when we tried to remove it after the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Robert P

customer_reviews.title: Hammered Copper firepit arrived over-hammered -- Three times
customer_reviews.text: I love this fire pit. Very nice looking. Far less obtrusive than a chiminea. However, there ARE some considerations of which you should be aware. Initially, I bought this from another site. That one arrived with huge dents in it. I sent it back. And because they were not very customer-oriented, I bought my second one from Amazon. It, too, arrived dented. It took a week and several calls but EVENTUALLY, UPS sent a return-it-free form, and picked it up. My third one also was dented. This time, I gently pounded it out with one tap. I love it. And while it was love at first sight, I DID have to work on the relationship to make it happen!
customer_reviews.author: Randy Martin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and looks even better than it would ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and looks even better than it would appear from the picture. We love fire pits: this one's a beauty. It's deep, so it's great for a couple of pieces of firewood. My partner has a habit of burning up branches and other tree waste, which I suspect has shortened the life of of our previous fire pits. He loves this one, and I don't think he'll abuse this one. It's just too pretty.
customer_reviews.author: Bill D

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: The copper hammered fire pit arrived quickly and undamaged. It is exactly how it is in the picture: big & roomy for holding a lot of wood. It's manly looking with elegance as well. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: carolynn palmer

customer_reviews.title: Good price for the size.  Cover rusts quickly.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as an insert for our patio fire pit. The copper is discoloring after a few uses and the cover is already rusting even though we used the cover it came with.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Deleon

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: The actual bowl is pretty nice. The stand is a little weak and the cover is very cheap. Our cover already ripped and all we did was was put it on? Now we need to find a better quality cover that will fit?
customer_reviews.author: Jason Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Beware:  Product Description is not accurate.
customer_reviews.text: This item is 12 inches deep not 21 inches as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Mike from PA

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and very easy to put together and
customer_reviews.text: Only used it once so far,but seems to work well. Nice looking and very easy to put together and use
customer_reviews.author: big john

customer_reviews.title: We've had to remove it from our patio and plan on burying the copper tub as a ground pit since the stand and cover are useless.
customer_reviews.text: This firepit does not hold up well at all! I purchased it the end of October of last year and its not usable by May of this year. After only 3 months on my outside paver patio the stand and the screen cover started to badly rust . After about 4 months the filmsy stand that comes with it starts to bend from the weight. We've had to remove it from our patio and plan on burying the copper tub as a ground pit since the stand and cover are useless. (we threw them out) When I complained to the company about this they never even responded. Don't buy this pit!!
customer_reviews.author: Carol - Merritt Island, Fla.

customer_reviews.title: Hot!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great fire pit; however, it is very hot! I didn't realize how much heat copper transfers. The only thing I don't like about this fire pit is it sits a little low to the ground (only about 2-3 inches from ground to bottom of pit). If you are using on a deck, you must have a firePROOF deck mat. Don't bother with a fire-RESISTANT one. Our first fire in this pit melted the asbestos mat we had underneath it and literally started burning the deck! Overall, great product and produces lots of heat. No more nights of being cold on the deck.
customer_reviews.author: Tami

customer_reviews.title: I wish it had small holes in the bottom to ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish it had small holes in the bottom to drain water, but it is high quality and very attractive.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: So glad we picked this one after reading so many reviews. It's very god quality and seems like it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs P

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The cover included ripped the first time I put it on.
customer_reviews.author: DENISE

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: works great had to elevate with bricks to get a better height. worked first time I used it,good good good
customer_reviews.author: Barbara E. Bush

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and fun.
customer_reviews.text: No assembly, which I love.nice big fire surface. Great cover and nice storage bag. A great addition to any outdoor activity
customer_reviews.author: Joan Miller

customer_reviews.title: Don't put on a wood deck!
customer_reviews.text: The cover that came with this is very low quality and cannot withstand the heat from the fire. The paint was gone in one use and rusted to heck and warped after that.
customer_reviews.author: Cod Family

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this believing that it was going to be a sturdy, high quality fire pit. It is extremely flimsy, cheap, thin, & poor quality. It arrived with the stand completely bent (all 3 legs were bent in different direction). The copper pot is so thin that it would not last through more than 3 fires before the bottom falls out. If you're looking for a quality fire pit, this is not it
customer_reviews.author: lainey

customer_reviews.title: Works great and looks good
customer_reviews.text: Works great - but know that if you put this on your grass it is low enough to the ground that it will scorch your grass.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Like it alot!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived super fast and really liked the look. Nice size really gives off alot of heat when you get the fire going. Overall I really like mine and have got a lot of use out of it in a few short months. I feel it was a good value, but not necessarily the most cost effecient way to go. Be aware that after your first fire the copper will no longer have the nice shiny look on the inside or out!
customer_reviews.author: tm

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: As listed it is thin. We used sand and it had a great fire. Deep enough it was protected. Perfect for our small courtyard and family parties. We got a lid for it elsewhere and it's perfect. We haven't used the cover at all. Not needed.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hansen-Palmus

customer_reviews.title: It looks good
customer_reviews.text: we haven't used it yet as winter is not quite here, but the cover already has a whole in it, so had to purchase a replacement already! Pit look good and hope to use it soon
customer_reviews.author: LMD

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a million dollars
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a million dollars. Love the color with the light of the fire. Easy clean. But cover didn't fit so well and ripped after second time we covered it. So had to buy a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Da_Mann

customer_reviews.title: Good looking, works fine but screen is pointless
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this fire pit except the lid. Like many other reviewers mine didn't even come close to fitting properly. It will still function and sit on top just fine but the brackets it's meant to sit on won't ever work because the diameter of the lid is smaller than the bucket. Would have given it 5 stars if not for the lid issue.
customer_reviews.author: clark

customer_reviews.title: nice backyard addition
customer_reviews.text: Very nice addition to any deck or backyard. Definitely use sand as insulater so as to not lose luster of copper finish.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: CobraCo SH101 Fire Tub
customer_reviews.text: I am delighted with this product. It is sturdy and well made. The screen could fit a bit better. I would still recommend it. Nothing like sitting around a fire pit on a crisp New England night.
customer_reviews.author: Jacksmom

customer_reviews.title: Very classy
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that the plastic cover did not fit anywhere NEAR (way too small), so I tried slit garbage bags, which dont hold p to the wind and weather of corse. So its hard to keep the rain ot which is important not to have standing water when trying to start a fire! Bt the copper is beatifl. Very elegant and heavy dty, not cheap looking at all. Sorry my yews dont work!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Rosar

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, no cover included
customer_reviews.text: the fire pit looked nice,but for one it didnt come with a cover as promised, secondly, the top grate that covers the fire pit rusted in spots after one night outside with no rain, the grate is cheaply made, and the copper fire pit bowl is thin copper. it isnt worth the 275.00.....
customer_reviews.author: Ramboni

customer_reviews.title: I love this firepit
customer_reviews.text: I love this firepit! I would have given it a 5 star, just wished it was a little bigger. I like that it can be moved around on my patio depending on the wind and where it's placed. Great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea B.

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction and not a good value
customer_reviews.text: This CobraCo SH101 Copper Fire Pit is constructed poorly. The screen top was dented and the handle welded on crooked. The copper bowl is very thin and probably not 100% copper (but no way to know for sure other than chemical testing). The stand is very thin and very light duty, making this all very expensive for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Ray R.

customer_reviews.title: One fire though and its black..g-bye cooper color
customer_reviews.text: It works. One fire though and its black..g-bye cooper color
customer_reviews.author: Peter Buck

customer_reviews.title: great fire pit
customer_reviews.text: This is a handsome copper pit that doesn't take up too much space in the back yard. The copper develops a nice patina with use. It has a nice look while the fire is going. I've read that the pit cover deteriorates over time but so far it's held out after two months and does it's job after 5 uses. I like covering it up after it cools of course but the cover seems like it may stick around for about a year at best. It would be nice if they included a canvas type of cover since you're not buying a cheap-o fire pit.
customer_reviews.author: chris janner

customer_reviews.title: Fire In The Hole
customer_reviews.text: We have enjoyed our fire pit ever since we got it. Our home is somewhat rustic so we did not want something that looked to modern. Great!
customer_reviews.author: Allan Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Need new water proof cover only
customer_reviews.text: Details: The fire Pit is great but the water proof cover leaks and the fire pit fills up with water. Need new cover. Thank you Tom Collins Resolution: Replacement
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E Collins

customer_reviews.title: Love this fire pit
customer_reviews.text: Love this fire pit!! Its even more beautiful than expected. Light weight & easy to move but doesn’t feel cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Boniello

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, lightweight, and turns a pretty color
customer_reviews.text: We've had this fire basin for a few months now and love it. There appears to be good air circulation, so the fires burn hot (i.e. good brightness and not too much smoke, although still smoke). The copper also turns a pretty color with burning, but that's true of all copper. I also really like the cover, and have put it on several of our larger and more unwieldy fires with no detrimental effect, as far as I can tell.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Lakin

customer_reviews.title: Turns black after first fire. If you aren't going ...
customer_reviews.text: Turns black after first fire. If you aren't going to polish it constantly, get a more affordable iron pit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but I like the patina caused by fires
customer_reviews.text: Very handsome fire bowl. Cleans up well, but I like the patina caused by fires, weather, and age.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Boxx

customer_reviews.title: the patina is actually a nice look although with prevention you can maintain the fresh ...
customer_reviews.text: has outlasted all the other fire pits. I used to go through one every two years living in the Florida keys due to rust, but this copper one had yet to show any rust. the patina is actually a nice look although with prevention you can maintain the fresh copper look. I prefer patina and not worrying about it.
customer_reviews.author: Everett Smith

customer_reviews.title: lovely, simple but elegant design
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful design; creates a lovely ambiance and is a great size.
customer_reviews.author: wendy west

customer_reviews.title: Copper fire pit package
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in the packaging and condition of the screen for the firepit when it arrived. Parts are bent in screen has holes.
customer_reviews.author: Harry M Elmendorf

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: turned black after one use and can not get original finish back
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

product_meta.title: CobraCo SH101 Hand Hammered 100% Copper Fire Pit with Screen and Cover
product_meta.description: This exquisite copper fire tub is extra deep for larger, longer-lasting fires. With the extra depth of this fire bowl, you will be able to enjoy bigger fires that can actually last the length of your party! A screen and vinyl protective outdoor cover are included.
feature_bullets: Extra deep tub for larger and longer lasting fire
Sturdy metal construction, contemporary stand design
Un-coated to provide a rustic texture and charm
Includes heavy duty screen cover and protective vinyl cover with elastic stretch band to hold cover securely on fire tub and prevent rain or leaves from entering

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars221 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
